body: Hi @polynomialdonut - after playing around with this myself, I think the issue might be with this change https://github.com/hashicorp/vagrant/pull/10902. I noticed that the listener wouldn't pick up changes from files inside a given subfolder, but files at the root of the share foldergets picked up... :thinking: I recommend rolling back to the previous version, as I believe what you were doing shouldn't be affected by the bug I linked to.

Thank you for your reply/efforts @briancain,

the changes are in a subfolder, and I just rechecked - they are picked up instantly, presumably due to the changes I mentioned above. I might retry the old settings to confirm that they would still lead to certain files being ignored (can't do it right now since I should get some things done at work, first).

issue.title: in v2.2.5 rsync__exclude broken

repository.name: vagrant
repository.description: Vagrant is a tool for building and distributing development environments.

issue.body:
### Vagrant version
2.2.5

### Host operating system
macOS Mojave

10.14.5 (18F132)
### Guest operating system
ubuntu/trusty64

### Vagrantfile
```ruby
# -*- mode: ruby -*-
# vi: set ft=ruby :
DATA_FOLDER     = '/data'
PROJECTS_FOLDER = File.join(DATA_FOLDER, 'projects')
SSH_FOLDER      = File.join(ENV['HOME'], '.ssh')
# All Vagrant configuration is done below. The "2" in Vagrant.configure
# configures the configuration version (we support older styles for
# backwards compatibility). Please don't change it unless you know what
# you're doing.
Vagrant.configure(2) do |config|
  # The most common configuration options are documented and commented below.
  # For a complete reference, please see the online documentation at
  # https://docs.vagrantup.com.
  config.ssh.forward_agent = true
  # Check required plugins

  %w(gatling-rsync hostmanager host-shell).each do |req|
    plugin = "vagrant-#{req}"
    unless Vagrant.has_plugin?(plugin)
      puts <<-ERROR
        FATAL: #{plugin.capitalize} plugin not detected. Please install the plugin with
        'vagrant plugin install #{plugin}'
      ERROR
      exit
    end
  end


  # Every Vagrant development environment requires a box. You can search for
  # boxes at https://atlas.hashicorp.com/search.
  config.vm.box = "ubuntu/trusty64"

  # Disable automatic box update checking. If you disable this, then
  # boxes will only be checked for updates when the user runs
  # `vagrant box outdated`. This is not recommended.
  # config.vm.box_check_update = false

  # Create a forwarded port mapping which allows access to a specific port
  # within the machine from a port on the host machine. In the example below,
  # accessing "localhost:8080" will access port 80 on the guest machine.
  # config.vm.network "forwarded_port", guest: 80, host: 8080
  # config.vm.network "forwarded_port", guest: 80, host: 8080

  # Create a private network, which allows host-only access to the machine
  # using a specific IP.
  # config.vm.network "private_network", ip: "192.168.33.10"
  config.vm.network "private_network", ip: "192.168.33.10"

  config.hostmanager.enabled = true
  config.hostmanager.manage_host = true
  config.hostmanager.ignore_private_ip = false
  config.hostmanager.include_offline = true

  config.vm.define 'default' do |node|
    node.hostmanager.aliases = [
        'localhost.dev.xxxx.local',
        'xxxx.dev.xxxx.local',

        # xxxx/xxxx',
        'xxxx.dev.xxxx.local',
        'xml.xxxx.dev.xxxx.local',

        # xxxx',
        'xxxx.dev.xxxx.local',
        'xxxx.test.xxxx.local',
    ]
  end


  # Create a public network, which generally matched to bridged network.
  # Bridged networks make the machine appear as another physical device on
  # your network.
  # config.vm.network "public_network"

  # Share an additional folder to the guest VM. The first argument is
  # the path on the host to the actual folder. The second argument is
  # the path on the guest to mount the folder. And the optional third
  # argument is a set of non-required options.
  # config.vm.synced_folder "../data", "/vagrant_data"
  config.vm.synced_folder PROJECTS_FOLDER, '/vagrant'

  if File.exists?(SSH_FOLDER)
    config.vm.synced_folder SSH_FOLDER, "/home/vagrant/.ssh", type: "rsync",
      owner: "vagrant",
      group: "vagrant",
      rsync__args: ["--verbose", "--archive", "-z"]
  end

  [
    File.join(PROJECTS_FOLDER, 'xxxx'),
    File.join(PROJECTS_FOLDER, 'xxxx_old'),
    File.join(PROJECTS_FOLDER, 'xxxx_altr')
  ].each do |sharedFolder|
    config.vm.synced_folder sharedFolder, sharedFolder, type: "rsync",
      owner: "vagrant",
      group: "vagrant",
      rsync__args: ["--verbose", "--archive", "-z", '--include="src/xxx/UiBundle/Resources/public/js/vendor/*.js"'],
      rsync__verbose: true,
      rsync__exclude: [
        ".idea",
        ".settings",
        ".buildpath",
        ".project",
        "node_modules",
        "app/cache",
        "app/logs"
      ]
  end

  # Provider-specific configuration so you can fine-tune various
  # backing providers for Vagrant. These expose provider-specific options.
  # Example for VirtualBox:
  #
  config.vm.provider "virtualbox" do |vb|
    host = RbConfig::CONFIG['host_os']

    # Give VM 1/4 system memory & access to half cpu cores on the host
    if host =~ /darwin/
      cpus = `sysctl -n hw.ncpu`.to_i / 2
      # sysctl returns Bytes and we need to convert to MB
      mem = `sysctl -n hw.memsize`.to_i / 1024 / 1024 / 4
    elsif host =~ /linux/
      cpus = `nproc`.to_i / 2
      # meminfo shows KB and we need to convert to MB
      mem = `grep 'MemTotal' /proc/meminfo | sed -e 's/MemTotal://' -e 's/ kB//'`.to_i / 1024 / 4
    else # sorry Windows folks, I can't help you
      cpus = 2
      mem = 1024
    end

    if mem < 4096
        mem = 4096
    end

    #vb.customize ["modifyhd", "disk id", "--resize", 60000]
    vb.customize ["modifyvm", :id, "--memory", mem]
    vb.customize ["modifyvm", :id, "--cpus", cpus]
  end
  #
  # View the documentation for the provider you are using for more
  # information on available options.

  # Define a Vagrant Push strategy for pushing to Atlas. Other push strategies
  # such as FTP and Heroku are also available. See the documentation at
  # https://docs.vagrantup.com/v2/push/atlas.html for more information.
  # config.push.define "atlas" do |push|
  #   push.app = "YOUR_ATLAS_USERNAME/YOUR_APPLICATION_NAME"
  # end

  # Enable provisioning with a shell script. Additional provisioners such as
  # Puppet, Chef, Ansible, Salt, and Docker are also available. Please see the
  # documentation for more information about their specific syntax and use.
  # config.vm.provision "shell", inline: <<-SHELL
  #   sudo apt-get update
  #   sudo apt-get install -y apache2
  # SHELL
  config.vm.provision "shell", inline: <<-SHELL

    # Tweeks
    ln -s /data/projects/xxxx/resources/vagrant/files/.bash_aliases /home/vagrant/.bash_aliases
    ln -s /data/projects/xxxx/resources/vagrant/files/dircolors.ansi-dark /home/vagrant/.dircolors

    # Update / Upgrade box
    sudo apt-get update
    sudo apt-get upgrade -y

    # Set mysql password to enable automated installation
    sudo debconf-set-selections <<< 'mysql-server mysql-server/root_password password root'
    sudo debconf-set-selections <<< 'mysql-server mysql-server/root_password_again password root'

    # Install required packages
    sudo apt-get install -y ssh \
    apache2 \
    mysql-client \
    mysql-server \
    git \
    curl \
    npm \
    php5 \
    php5-cli \
    php5-dev \
    php5-curl \
    php5-mysql \
    php5-xsl \
    php5-gd \
    php5-intl \
    gearman-job-server \
    libgearman-dev \
    php5-gearman \
    gearman-tools \
    openjdk-7-jdk \
    gettext \
    unzip \
    mc \
    htop \
    mlocate


    #Add ServerName to the default config because it prevents a notice when restarting apache
    sudo echo -e "ServerName vagrant-ubuntu-trusty-64\n" | sudo tee -a /etc/apache2/apache2.conf

    # Locale
    sudo locale-gen nl_NL

    # Node
    curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/creationix/nvm/v0.32.1/install.sh | bash
    nvm install 0.10.26
    nvm use 0.10.26

    # Gulp
    sudo npm install -g gulp

    # Bower
    sudo npm install -g bower

    # We need this because gulp will throw
    # /usr/bin/env: node: No such file or directory
    sudo ln -nfs /usr/bin/nodejs /usr/bin/node

    # Enable Apache modules
    sudo a2enmod rewrite
    sudo a2enmod ssl

    # run apache als vagrant user
    sudo sed -i 's/www-data/vagrant/g' /etc/apache2/envvars

    # copy the vhosts
    sudo cp /data/projects/xxxx/resources/vagrant/files/vhosts/xxxx.conf /etc/apache2/sites-available/xxxx.conf
    sudo cp /data/projects/xxxx2/resources/vagrant/files/vhosts/xxxx2.conf /etc/apache2/sites-available/xxxx2.conf
    sudo cp /data/projects/xxxx3/resources/vagrant/files/vhosts/xxxx3.conf /etc/apache2/sites-available/xxxx3.conf

    sudo a2dissite 000-default
    sudo a2ensite xxxx xxxx2 xxxx3


    # MySQL no bind to localhost
    sudo echo "[mysqld]" >/etc/mysql/conf.d/vagrant.cnf
    sudo echo "bind-address	= 0.0.0.0" >>/etc/mysql/conf.d/vagrant.cnf

    # Create user and allow all
    mysql -uroot -proot -e "grant all on xxxx_dev.* to xxxx@'%' identified by 'xxxx';"
    mysql -uroot -proot -e "create schema xxxx_dev default character set latin1;"

    mysql -uroot -proot -e "grant all on xxxx_test.* to xxxx@'%' identified by 'xxxx';"
    mysql -uroot -proot -e "create schema xxxx_test default character set latin1;"

    mysql -uroot -proot -e "grant all on xxxx_dev.* to xxxx@'%' identified by 'xxxx_dev';"
    mysql -uroot -proot -e "create schema xxxx_dev default character set latin1;"

    mysql -uroot -proot -e "grant all on xxxx_test.* to xxxx@'%' identified by 'xxxx_dev';"
    mysql -uroot -proot -e "create schema xxxx_test default character set latin1;"

    # SOLR Install
    sudo wget -c -N https://archive.apache.org/dist/lucene/solr/5.2.1/solr-5.2.1.tgz -O /tmp/solr-5.2.1.tgz >/dev/null 2>&1
    cd /tmp && sudo tar -xzf /tmp/solr-5.2.1.tgz solr-5.2.1/bin/install_solr_service.sh --strip-components=2
    sudo /bin/bash /tmp/install_solr_service.sh /tmp/solr-5.2.1.tgz -u vagrant

    # SOLR Configure
    sudo ln -s /data/projects/xxxx/solr/product-core-xxxx/ /var/solr/data/product-core-xxxx
    sudo ln -s /data/projects/xxxx/solr/product-core-xxxx-test/ /var/solr/data/product-core-xxxx-test
    sudo ln -s /data/projects/xxxx/solr/xxxx-core-xxx2/ /var/solr/data/xxxx-core-xxx2
    sudo ln -s /data/projects/xxxx/solr/xxxx-core-xxx2-test/ /var/solr/data/xxxx-core-xxx2-test


    # Composer
    sudo curl -sS https://getcomposer.org/installer | sudo php -- --install-dir=/usr/local/bin --filename=composer

    # Some required directories
    sudo mkdir -p /data/projects/xxxx/logs \
                  /data/projects/xxxx/cache \
                  /data/projects/xxxx/cache \
                  /data/projects/xxxx/logs \
                  /data/projects/_logs/xxxx \
                  /data/projects/_logs/xxxx

    # xxxx required folders
    mkdir -p /data/projects/xxxx/cache \
             /data/projects/xxxx/logs \
             /data/projects/xxxx/cache/gacl \
             /data/projects/xxxx/cache/smarty \
             /data/projects/xxxx/cache/magpie \
             /data/projects/xxxx/smarty/templates_c \
             /data/projects/xxxx/uploads \
             /data/projects/xxxx/uploads/help \
             /data/projects/xxxx/uploads/fckeditor \
             /data/projects/xxxx/uploads/forms \
             /data/projects/xxxx/uploads/statistics \
             /data/projects/_logs/xxxx

    touch /data/projects/xxxx/logs/propel.log
    touch /data/projects/_logs/xxxx/secure.xxxx.nl-error.log


    # xxx2 required files
    touch /data/projects/xxxx/logs/propel.log

    sudo chown -R vagrant:vagrant /data/projects
    # some sudo commands creates root folder here
    sudo chown -R vagrant:vagrant /home/vagrant


    # Make sure we delay as much as possible services restart, because they depend on file permissions
    sudo service solr restart
    sudo service apache2 restart
    sudo service mysql restart


  SHELL

  config.vm.provision :host_shell do |host_shell|
    host_shell.inline = 'cd /data/projects/xxxx && composer install && cd /data/projects/xxxx2 && composer install'
  end

  # Initalitation of Sontara project
  config.vm.provision "shell", inline: <<-SHELL
    cd /data/projects/xxxx
    php app/console doctrine:schema:update --force
    php app/console doctrine:fixtures:load --fixtures="/data/projects/xxxx/src/Generic/SonataBundle/PageBundle/DataFixtures/ORM" --no-interaction
    php app/console sonata:page:update-core-routes --site=all
    php app/console sonata:page:create-snapshots --site=all

    ./resources/scripts/project-permissions-linux.sh

    cd /data/projects/xxxx
    php app/console propel:model:build
    php app/console propel:sql:insert --force

    ./resources/scripts/project-permissions-linux.sh

    php app/console assets:install
    php app/console cache:clear


    cd /data/projects/xxxx
    /bin/bash /data/projects/xxxx/resources/scripts/import-database.sh
    /bin/bash /data/projects/xxxx/resources/scripts/import-clean-data.sh


    cd /data/projects/xxxx
    php app/console doctrine:schema:update --force
    php app/console doctrine:fixtures:load
    php app/console sonata:page:create-snapshots --site=all
    php app/console sonata:page:update-core-routes --site=all
    php app/console sonata:page:create-snapshots --site=all
    php app/console sonata:easy-extends:generate SonataPageBundle

    php app/console  assets:install
    php app/console cache:clear


  SHELL

  config.vm.provision "shell", inline: "sudo apache2ctl restart", run: "always"

  # Automatically sync when machines with rsync folders come up.
  config.gatling.latency = 1.5
  config.gatling.time_format = "%H:%M:%S"
  config.gatling.rsync_on_startup = true
end
```


### Expected behavior
It should run without any problem, I make it run I've downgraded to 2.2.4

### Actual behavior
It gives an error:

```
/opt/vagrant/embedded/gems/2.2.5/gems/vagrant-2.2.5/plugins/synced_folders/rsync/helper.rb:25:in `exclude_to_regexp': wrong number of arguments (given 2, expected 1) (ArgumentError)
	from /Users/tsirin/.vagrant.d/gems/2.4.6/gems/vagrant-gatling-rsync-0.9.0/lib/vagrant-gatling-rsync/command/rsync_auto.rb:70:in `block (3 levels) in execute'
	from /Users/tsirin/.vagrant.d/gems/2.4.6/gems/vagrant-gatling-rsync-0.9.0/lib/vagrant-gatling-rsync/command/rsync_auto.rb:69:in `each'
	from /Users/tsirin/.vagrant.d/gems/2.4.6/gems/vagrant-gatling-rsync-0.9.0/lib/vagrant-gatling-rsync/command/rsync_auto.rb:69:in `block (2 levels) in execute'
	from /Users/tsirin/.vagrant.d/gems/2.4.6/gems/vagrant-gatling-rsync-0.9.0/lib/vagrant-gatling-rsync/command/rsync_auto.rb:54:in `each'
	from /Users/tsirin/.vagrant.d/gems/2.4.6/gems/vagrant-gatling-rsync-0.9.0/lib/vagrant-gatling-rsync/command/rsync_auto.rb:54:in `block in execute'
	from /opt/vagrant/embedded/gems/2.2.5/gems/vagrant-2.2.5/lib/vagrant/plugin/v2/command.rb:238:in `block in with_target_vms'
	from /opt/vagrant/embedded/gems/2.2.5/gems/vagrant-2.2.5/lib/vagrant/plugin/v2/command.rb:232:in `each'
	from /opt/vagrant/embedded/gems/2.2.5/gems/vagrant-2.2.5/lib/vagrant/plugin/v2/command.rb:232:in `with_target_vms'
	from /Users/tsirin/.vagrant.d/gems/2.4.6/gems/vagrant-gatling-rsync-0.9.0/lib/vagrant-gatling-rsync/command/rsync_auto.rb:38:in `execute'
	from /opt/vagrant/embedded/gems/2.2.5/gems/vagrant-2.2.5/lib/vagrant/cli.rb:66:in `execute'
	from /opt/vagrant/embedded/gems/2.2.5/gems/vagrant-2.2.5/lib/vagrant/environment.rb:290:in `cli'
	from /Users/tsirin/.vagrant.d/gems/2.4.6/gems/vagrant-gatling-rsync-0.9.0/lib/vagrant-gatling-rsync/action/startup_rsync.rb:40:in `block in call'
```

### Steps to reproduce
1. Add some folders to rsync__exclude
2. up your machine

body:
It is a pattern matching issue.  We have seen this too.

we exclude `['data/']` and we have a sub directory called `edata` that should not be excluded.  But it is.

If I am reading this correctly exclude is interpreting `['data/']` as  `['*data/']`

https://github.com/hashicorp/vagrant/pull/10902/files/1b0148bc783298c7aa16a519e133bb26bcc1cc9f#diff-de2df059af671fe3c2f160dacc56994dR124

Hi @jweir - I don't believe that's the case. Having a folder `edata` alongside `data`, `edata` gets synced. I don't think this is related to the exclude params, but to how the watcher is set up. If it were an excludes issue then it wouldn't work properly on the initial sync.

```
brian@localghost:vagrant-sandbox % be vagrant rsync-auto bork                                           ±[●●][master]
==> bork: Doing an initial rsync...
==> bork: Rsyncing folder: /home/brian/code/vagrant-sandbox/scripts/ => /vagrant
==> bork:   - Exclude: [".vagrant/", "data/"]
==> bork: Watching: /home/brian/code/vagrant-sandbox/scripts
^C%                                                                                                                   brian@localghost:vagrant-sandbox % be vagrant ssh -c "ls -lah /vagrant" bork                            ±[●●][master]
total 20K
drwxr-xr-x  5 vagrant vagrant 4.0K Jul 19 19:05 .
drwxr-xr-x 24 root    root    4.0K Jul 19 18:59 ..
drwxr-xr-x  2 vagrant vagrant 4.0K Jul 19 19:04 edata
drwxr-xr-x  4 vagrant vagrant 4.0K Jul 15 16:49 linux
drwxr-xr-x  2 vagrant vagrant 4.0K Jan 22 17:07 windows
Connection to 127.0.0.1 closed.
```

If you use a `*` in your exclude, then yes that would be the case, but Vagrant doesn't add a `*`. If you have a folder structure where `edata` is inside of `data`, and you ignore the top level folder `data, then `edata` won't be synced because you told rsync to ignore its parent directory...

As I mentioned earlier I believe the issue seems to be that the watcher only seems to be watching the top most directory level of a folder, and doesn't seem to pick up any sub directory changes.

All our files are initially syncing as expected.  All files and directories are watched as expected, except any directory or file which matches an exclude entry.

If excludes is `['data/', 'log']` then sub directory `lib/edata` is not watched, or a file named `flog.rb` in any directory. Yes `log` is missing the ending `/`.

```
'lib/edata/'.match (Foo.exclude_to_regexp 'data/')
=> #<MatchData "data/">
```
`Listen.to` takes the array of regex rules.

```
require 'listen'
Listen.to('.', ignore: [/data\//])  { |n,a,r| puts "#{n}, #{a}, #{r}" }.start
```

If I `mkdir` `edata` and then `touch edata/foo` nothing happens, the path is ignored. But not with

```
require 'listen'
Listen.to('.', ignore: [/^data\//])  { |n,a,r| puts "#{n}, #{a}, #{r}" }.start
# or 
# Listen.to('.', ignore: [/\/data\//])  { |n,a,r| puts "#{n}, #{a}, #{r}" }.start
```

But, you can not prepend an exclude with a `/` since the helper strips those out.

The previous version of `exclude_to_regexp` included a `^` to enforce the start of the name and included the hostpath.  But I don't really understand what was going in there.

https://github.com/briancain/vagrant/blob/3b540e502feb6576770ae6bbb4358e6f165cd57a/plugins/synced_folders/rsync/helper.rb#L28

I have tried to trace the code through to understand how this all works better, but I have gotten a bit lost. In other words, I might not be helping at all here. So, if the above is not useful, I will be quiet now. 😄

issue.title: @ #57 | should fix rsync auto error
issue.body:
connect https://github.com/teracyhq-incubator/teracy-dev-essential/pull/56.
please check this PR! Thank you so much.

body:
I'm going to lock this issue because it has been closed for _30 days_ ⏳. This helps our maintainers find and focus on the active issues.

If you have found a problem that seems similar to this, please open a new issue and complete the issue template so we can capture all the details necessary to investigate further.
